com.absio.broker.mapper

Class UserMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.absio.broker.mapper.AbstractMapper
      • com.absio.broker.mapper.UserMapper

  • public class UserMapper
extends AbstractMapper
    This handles all user operations with the Absio Broker™ application. It is used for create, delete and authentication of users.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserMapper(Session session)
      Default constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Create a user on the Absio Broker™ application.
      void delete()
      Deletes the authenticated user from the server.

      Uses the provided KeyRing to authenticate with the Absio Broker™ application.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserMapper

        public UserMapper(Session session)
           throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                  NoSuchPaddingException
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        session - the session for the mapper
        Throws:
        NoSuchPaddingException - thrown if the default padding for symmetric encryption is not supported
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if ECDH is not supported

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public UUID create(List<IndexedECPrivateKey> keys)
            throws IOException,
                   BrokerException,
                   InterruptedException
        Create a user on the Absio Broker™ application. This will return the new user's ID. The public portion of the passed in private keys will be passed to the Absio Broker™ application. They will be stored in relation to the new user.
        Parameters:
        keys - the set of private keys for the new user - ONLY the public portion will be passed to Absio Broker™ application
        Returns:
        the user id for the newly created user - represented as a UUID
        Throws:
        BrokerException - thrown when the Absio Broker™ application has an issue with the request
        IOException - thrown when there are any IO issues
        InterruptedException - thrown when there is an interruption during rate limiting

      • delete

        public void delete()
            throws IOException,
                   BrokerException,
                   InterruptedException
        Deletes the authenticated user from the server.

        NOTE: this cannot be undone!

        Throws:
        BrokerException - thrown when the Absio Broker™ application has an issue with the request
        IOException - thrown when there are any IO issues
        InterruptedException - thrown when there is an interruption during rate limiting

      • logIn

        public void logIn(KeyRing keyRing)
           throws BrokerException,
                  SignatureException,
                  IOException,
                  InvalidKeyException,
                  InterruptedException
        Uses the provided KeyRing to authenticate with the Absio Broker™ application. If successful the credentials for the authenticated session will be set on the ServerMapperRestClientSession of the mapper.
        Parameters:
        keyRing - the user's private key ring.
        Throws:
        BrokerException - thrown when the Absio Broker™ application has an issue with the request
        SignatureException - thrown when there was an error signing data to be sent to Absio Broker™ application
        IOException - thrown when there are any IO issues
        InvalidKeyException - thrown when there was an error with the key for signing data to be sent to Absio Broker™ application
        InterruptedException - thrown when there is an interruption during rate limiting
